The quantifier '[^>]*' is always entered despite having a minimum of 0. This is because the assertion '\b' contradicts with the element(s) after the quantifier. Either set the minimum to 1 (+) or change the assertion.

suggestions.desc: Change the quantifier to +.

Unexpected unnecessary non-capturing group. This group can be removed without changing the behaviour of the regex.

The quantifier '[0-9a-f]+' can exchange characters with '(?:[_a-z0-9\-]|\\(?:\\[0-9a-f]+ ?))*'. Using any string accepted by /[\dA-F]+/i, this can be exploited to cause at least polynomial backtracking. This might cause exponential backtracking.

The quantifier '[0-9a-f]+' can exchange characters with '(?:[_a-z0-9\-]|\\(?:\\[0-9a-f]+ ?))*'. Using any string accepted by /[\dA-F]+/i, this can be exploited to cause at least polynomial backtracking. This is going to cause exponential backtracking resulting in exponential worst-case runtime behavior.
